result.execSummary:
The defendant Echo L Hoffman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be paid in full no later than November 1, 2014.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Defendant is prohibited from having any contact with the premises of Express Convenience Center located in Wautoma, Wisconsin.  Defendant is prohibited from having any contact whatsoever with A.Stake.  Defendant is not to be employed in any capacity which would call for working with or around vulnerable adults.    Defendant is prohibited from issuing any checks for payment or maintaining any open checking accounts. Defendant is not to serve in any capacity as a fiduciary for another individual and is not to be responsible for another or their assets.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Same repayment provisions apply as noted above for Count No. 1.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 3:00 PM: Defendant Echo L Hoffman in court with attorney Bryan D. Keberlein.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Resolution recited by ADA.  Def and counsel concur w/recital of State.  Court entertains waiver of pre-lim hearing.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of pre-lim hearing.  Def BOT.  INFO Filed.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant. Meds/Treatment serving no impairment on proceeding today.  Elements of offense explained.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed - Victim's Guardian present in courtroom.  Plea Ct 1 w/o Repeater Enh:  NC  Plea Ct 2 w/o Repeater Enh:  NC  Court accepts pleas and enters JOC.  Repeater Component attached to both Counts Dismissed.  Victim's Guardian makes statement to the Court.  Counsel confirm resolution is a joint recommendation.  Statement by Def:  Yes, explains actions and apologizes.  The Court:  Accepts resolution:  S/W - 4 yrs probation as to both counts - concurrent to one another and any existing period of supervision or sentence being served.  Conditions:  Pay Rest of $55.00 to be paid in full no later than 11/1/14; No Contact with the Express Convenience Store located in Wautoma; No contact whatsoever with A.S. (victim); Not to be employed in any capacity working around or with any vulnerable adult; Not to possess any open checking accounts or issue any checks; Not to serve in any capacity as a fiduciary for another individual - not to be responsible for another or their assets; Court Costs plus DNA Surcharge - 60 DTP or PP.  Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 2, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Case called @ 1:12 PM: Defendant Echo L Hoffman in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi for Bryan D. Keberlein, both appearing via video.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Per SPD:  Def was under the impression that the correct hearing date was 8/7/14.  Def states she was in court in Portage Co this morning and was arrested on our warrant.  Per ADA:  Believes case was resolved with her attorney.  Was not aware that Def was released from custody in Wood Co.  ADA would not oppose the Court ordering a Signature Bond.  The Court:  Continuation of the previous bond ordered is authorized.  Benefit of the doubt given by the Court.  P/S Scheduled.   Defendant confirms supervision continues.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
